means: <口>（使蜡外流的）蜡烛心结的烛花

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"资贼，强盗"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: robber, thief, burglar, bandit, gangster, pirate
means: robber ： 指以暴力或威胁等手段强行夺取他人财物的人。
thief ： 普通用词含义广泛，一般专指盗窍者。
burglar ： 指夜间撬窗破门行窃的人。
bandit ： 指在乡间或小林地区结帮活动，使用恐吓或暴力行窃的人。现指有组织或单独进行抢窃的盗匪。
gangster ： 指结伙进行各种非法活动的武装歹徒。

sentence.Network_cn: 小偷是从二楼的窗户进入屋里的。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English thīof, thēof, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch dief and German Dieb, also to theft

entry.def: A thief is a person who steals something from another person.

means.word_mean: 1. a criminal who takes property belonging to someone else with the intention of keeping it or selling it

Sentence.sentence: They range from minor cases of deliberate damaging of things to much more serious offenses, such as car accidents involving drunk drivers or bank robberies but Florence has to report all of these violations from the thief who took typewriters from every unlock room in the dormitory to the thief who stole one million dollars worth of art work from the university museum.

They range from minor cases of deliberate damaging of things to much more serious offenses, such as car accidents involving drunk drivers or bank robberies but Florence has to report all of these violations from the thief who took typewriters from every unlock room in the dormitory to the thief who stole one million dollars worth of art work from the university museum.

sentences.en: The thief was trapped by the police in an old house.
sentences.cn: 小偷被警察困在一所旧房子里。

jushi.english: The thief was closely tracked by the policeman.
jushi.chinese: 那窃贼被警察严密地跟踪着。

jushi.english: I turned the thief over to the guards at the building.
jushi.chinese: 我把小偷交给了大楼警卫。

jushi.english: The notorious thief was sent to prison for his many crimes.
jushi.chinese: 这罪恶昭彰的窃贼因多次犯罪而被送进监狱。
